dl.dd: For trees built with a content builder - that is, those that do not have XULAttr("flags")="dont-build-content" set -- the contentView will be a reference to the interface("nsITreeContentView") for the tree. This interface lets you retrieve the DOM element corresponding to a given a row index and vice versa. For trees that are not built with a content builder, the functions of interface("nsITreeContentView") will not be available, since there are no DOM nodes to retrieve. In newer versions of Mozilla, the contentView property is actually a synonym for the XULProp("view") property, since the two interfaces are flattened together into a single interface in JavaScript. This property is read-only.
